response: So I drove them around until, all of a sudden, one of them says:
context/0: A couple of ladies I picked up on Sunset.
context/2: Well, Mr. Keddie, I notice that trip number 984 on your sheet is one which you have marked the destination to be Whittier and Wilshire.
context/3: I'm sorry, Your Honour, of course.
context/4: The court would like to look at those papers too, Mr. Prosecutor.
context/6: Now let me have the receipt.

context: Who called you in?
response: The owner of the Vista Motel.
context/0: On Wednesday around noon.
context/1: Dr. Renault, when was the first time you were called in to treat Mr. Davenport?
context/2: You're still under oath.
context/3: You were sworn in yesterday, sir.
context/4: Dr. Renault to the stand, please.
context/5: If the court please, I'd like to continue my cross-examination of Dr. Renault.

context: I just have to turn in a story each day.
response: And you must confess, you haven't given me very much to turn in so far.
context/0: No good to complain to me about it.
context/2: These things can't be done overnight, you know.
context/3: After all, we've only had four days.
context/8: We ride in the dark tonight.
